details.title: Bills to be taken up for consideration in Lok Sabha
details.content:
1. The Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill, 2018.
  2. The Homoeopathy Central Council (Amendment) Bill, 2018.
  3.   The Criminal Law (Amendment) Bill, 2018.
Defence Minister Nirmala Sitharaman during the celebration of18th Kargil diwas at India gate. (Photo| EPS/ Shekhar Yadav)
Sitting begins in both the houses of the Parliament amidst heavy rainfall in Delhi.

details.title: TDP continues their protest for the seventh day
details.content:
Earlier visuals of Telugu Desam Party MPs protesting in Parliament premises over their demand for special status to Andhra Pradesh, pic.twitter.com/IpsBK0Jg2g

— ANI (@ANI) July 26, 2018

details.title: Rajeev Gowda raises the issue of truckers strike in Rajya Sabha.
details.content:
Congress MP Rajeev Gowda raised the issue of truckers strike in Rajya Sabha. He said that the strike is causing a cascading effect onto other industries. 

READ MORE | What, why and when of all-India truckers' strike

details.title: Congress MPs create Ruckus in Lok Sabha
details.content: Congress MP Jyotiraditya Scindia says a central government project has been implemented in his constituency where he was not invited. Union Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari says it was an oversight and expresses regret. To which Congress MPs objected.

details.title: Congress MPs create Ruckus in Lok Sabha
details.content: Congress MP Jyotiraditya Scindia says a central government project has been implemented in his constituency where he was not invited. Union Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari says it was an oversight and expresses regret. To which Congress MPs objected.
Congress MPs arrive at the Parliament for the seventh setting of the Monsoon Session. (Photo | EPS/ Shekhar Yadav)

details.title: Truckers' strike raised in Lok Sabha
details.content: AIADMK  MP P R. Sundaram says the truckers' strike has affected perishable goods sector such as eggs and vegetable which hiked up prices of the essential item. He also requested Union Highway Minister Nitin Gadkari to resolve this issue.

details.title: Status of eminence not given to Jio Institute: Prakash Javadekar
details.content: Union HRD Minister Prakash Javadekar says the Jio institute has not been granted any status of eminence. He added it has been selected under greenfield category and only given letter of intent.

details.title: Rahul Gandhi in the Parliament house
details.content: Congress president Rahul Gandhi arrives at the Parliament house. (Photo | EPS/ Shekhar Yadav)
Rajya Sabha will reconvene at 2pm.
BJP MP Maheish Girri, prior to the adjournment of the upper house,  raises the issue of death of three girls due to starvation. He added that the Delhi government is trying to cover up the incident.

details.title: Maneka Gandhi proceeds to move The Trafficking of Persons (Prevention, Protection and Rehabilitation) Bill
details.content: "How can we sit silent when we see women and children being bought and sold like slaves?" asked Union Women and Child Development Minister Maneka Gandhi.

You can fight someone with all your mind but hate is a choice. Now whenever I come across BJP MPs, they take 2 steps back thinking I'll hug them. One thing that religion teaches us is you can't get imprisoned by hatred.We'll take on PM&BJP but we don't need to hate them: R Gandhi pic.twitter.com/KhWdOFD3pL

— ANI (@ANI) July 25, 2018

details.title: Differentiate between trafficked and volunteer sex workers: Shashi Tharoor
details.content:
Congress MP Shashi Tharoor remarks that the government may not know the difference between ‘persecution’ and ‘prosecution.’ He says the Bill raises many serious concerns. He says a comprehensive legislation is the need of the hour. Tharoor says that this Bill is a rehash of existing laws. 

He also urges the government to study how existing laws have been applied. He says that the Bill must differentiate between those who are trafficked into sex work, and adult, consenting women who have entered sex work.
Congress MP Shashi Tharoor suggests the Trafficking Bill shoud be sent to Standing Committee to address issues, several MPs join the demand.

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prasad gives statement on Fake News
details.content: IT Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad takes the issue of misuse of social media platforms and circulation of Fake News leading to rise in violence and lynching.

details.title: Ravi Shankar Prasad on Fake News crackdown
details.content: A second notice has been issued to Whatsapp to check circulation of a special message. The Home Ministry has issued advisories to the states: Ravi Shankar Prasad, IT Minister.

Rajya Sabha MPs of opposition parties slam BJP government over spread of fake news, hate-mongering on social media, and asks for solid steps to curb rumours as well as defamatory and seditious content.

The party which came to power in 2014 is responsible for digital mobs: West Bengal Rajya Sabha MP Derek O' Brien

Sh. Derek O'Brien's remarks | Calling Attention on misuse of social media: https://t.co/1JD2tdN3mG via @YouTube

— Rajya Sabha TV (@rajyasabhatv) July 26, 2018

"Human trafficking is a social issue not a political issue. As much as I appreciate and support the government when they say we will bring in a special team to curb trafficking, police sensitisation must be done because most of the victims are traumatised and are vulnerable. In the same way, the rehabilitation program also must be well-thought-out so as to help the smooth integration of victims back into society," says NCP Lok Sabha MP Supriya Sule.

After Government issued notice to #WhatsApp and it reduced number of fwds to 5, it now plans to remove fwd button adjacent to video or audio msg; they also plan to bring fact checking and fake news verification mechanism: Union Minister @rsprasad #ParliamentQuestion @GoI_MeitY pic.twitter.com/SCMPgxK2eB

— PIB India (@PIB_India) July 26, 2018
Opposition MPs in Lok Sabha raise questions over the Anti-trafficking bill saying it is neither clear and nor comprehensivs in many parts.
Rajya Sabha passes Negotiable Instruments (Amendment) Bill, 2018.
Union Minister for Women and Child Development, Maneka Gandhi addresses the concerns raised by MPs of opposition parties in the Lok Sabha.

"The bill has a compassionate view of all the victims, especially those in the sex trade. The bill will ensure the formation of the National Anti-trafficking bureau and strengthen it. The participants of the committee have also clearly been defined in the bill," says Maneka Gandhi.

#WATCH: Yes we do fear hugging Rahul Gandhi as our wives might divorce us after that. Also, Section 377 hasn't been scrapped as yet. If he gets married, we will hug him: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey on Rahul Gandhi statement 'Now BJP MPs take 2 steps back thinking I'll hug them' pic.twitter.com/gUVMeyjcgw

— ANI (@ANI) July 26, 2018
The anti-trafficking bill is passed in Lok Sabha.
Lok Sabha now takes up The Homeopathy Council (Amendment) Bill, 2018.
Minister Prakash Javadekar moves The National Council for Teacher Education (Amendment) Bill, 2018 in Rajya Sabha.
Both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha are adjourned till 11 am on Monday, July 30.

Social media platforms must provide tech solutions to filter fake news: Union Minister Ravi Shankar Prasad in Rajya Sabha
